---
slug: /234
title: "This Week In React #234: TanStack DB, TanStack Query, React Router, Vite, Redux Toolkit, Parcel | 0.80 RC, Expo, Legal, Re.Pack, Skia, Radon IDE, Rive | Rslib, Composites, Lightning CSS, Accessibility, V8"
authors: [tboba, kacperkapusciak]
date: 05-14-2025
---

With a slightly quieter week, we come mostly with great articles we think you might like, alongside a few interesting releases\! We're so excited about the Vite team working on RSC support, a new React Query proposal, in conjunction with the features coming in React Native 0.80, but there are still many new topics here to look at.

segments.source_content: A brand-new library from the TanStack team has been introduced in collaboration with ElectricSQL, which brings a lot of exciting features. It gives you a blazing fast query engine, fine-grained reactivity for minimal re-renders, robust transaction primitives and normalized data by default\!

translations.fr: Une toute nouvelle bibliothÃ¨que de l'Ã©quipe TanStack a Ã©tÃ© introduite en collaboration avec ElectricSQL, apportant de nombreuses fonctionnalitÃ©s passionnantes. Elle offre un moteur de requÃªtes ultra-rapide, une rÃ©activitÃ© fine pour des rendus minimaux, des primitives de transaction robustes et des donnÃ©es normalisÃ©es par dÃ©faut !
translations.en: Une toute nouvelle bibliothÃ¨que de l'Ã©quipe TanStack a Ã©tÃ© introduite en collaboration avec ElectricSQL, apportant de nombreuses fonctionnalitÃ©s passionnantes. Elle vous offre un moteur de requÃªtes ultra-rapide, une rÃ©activitÃ© fine pour des re-rendus minimaux, des primitives de transaction robustes et des donnÃ©es normalisÃ©es par dÃ©faut !

segments.source_content: It is built on TanStack Store and is working with and alongside TanStack Query, which extends its capabilities with collections, live queries and optimistic mutations.

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Build professional design system in less than a day, using Hope AI, new model by Bit.Cloud](https://bit.cloud/solutions/design-systems?utm_source=ThisWeekInReact&campaign=DesignSystem)
- ğŸ‘€ [React PR \- Integrate React RSC with Vite](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/33152): An implementation of React Server Components support in Vite. There used to be a community proposal in the past but this time it's coming officially from the Vite team.
- ğŸ‘€ [React Query RFC \- Unified Imperative Query Methods](https://github.com/TanStack/query/discussions/9135): As the API of TanStack Query grows, the creators proposed to reduce the number of six functions with similar functionality to two unique methods \- `query()` and `infiniteQuery()`.
- ğŸ“œ [Static as a Server](https://overreacted.io/static-as-a-server/): Dan draws parallels between the Astro and built-time React Server Components for creating static sites without a server.
- ğŸ“œ [React Hook Factory \- how to create custom hooks programmatically](https://tylur.blog/react-hook-factory/): A clever pattern to reduce boilerplate when setting up a new React Context.
- ğŸ“œ [No, react context is not causing too many renders](https://blacksheepcode.com/posts/no_react_context_is_not_causing_too_many_renders): Argues that using React context is fine, and re-render problems are more likely related to large context values and controlled components.
- ğŸ“œ [Dependency Inversion in React: Building Truly Testable Components](https://cekrem.github.io/posts/dependency-inversion-in-react/): Implementing the SOLID principle by passing dependencies as props.
- ğŸ“œ [Using OpenAuth with React Router](https://seanpaulcampbell.com/blog/openauth-react-router/): Comprehensive 2-part tutorial explaining how to implement authentication using React Router, OpenAuth and deploying on AWS with SST.
- ğŸ“œ [Client-Side React Rocks](https://marmelab.com/blog/2025/05/09/client-side-react-rocks.html): On the example of tabular layout, the author argues client-side React features like `useContext` and `createPortal` provide better DX than Server Components.
- ğŸ“œ [The Limits of RSC: A Practitioner's Journey](https://www.nirtamir.com/articles/the-limits-of-rsc-a-practitioners-journey): Nir tried to implement infinite scrolling UI using Server Components, but ran into a wall. Spoiler: He used React Query instead.
- ğŸ“œ [How to Build a Custom React Renderer](https://blog.swmansion.com/how-to-build-a-custom-react-renderer-595dc4a9cb1c): Using the `react-reconciler` package to build a video composition software.
- ğŸ“œ [Patterns for state management with actors in React with XState](https://www.typeonce.dev/article/patterns-for-state-management-with-actors-in-react-with-xstate)
- ğŸ“œ [How To Integrate React Query With AG Grid?](https://scientyficworld.org/how-to-integrate-react-query-with-ag-grid/)
- ğŸ“¦ [React Router 7.6 \- new `routeDiscovery` option](https://github.com/remix-run/react-router/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md#v760): New config option introduced granting more control over the Lazy Route Discovery feature.
- ğŸ“¦ [Redux Toolkit 2.8 \- Infinite Query Page Params, RN compatibility](https://github.com/reduxjs/redux-toolkit/releases/tag/v2.8.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [Parcel 2.15 \- New HTML and SVG to JSX transformer](https://parceljs.org/blog/v2-15-0/)
- ğŸ“¦ [eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect](https://github.com/NickvanDyke/eslint-plugin-react-you-might-not-need-an-effect)
- ğŸ¥ [Jack Herrington \- Server Functions Don't Exist (It Matters)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FPJvlhee04E)
- ğŸ¥ [Lee Robinson \- Multi-tenant SaaS apps with Next.js and Vercel](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vVYlCnNjEWA)
- ğŸ¥ [Epic Web Conf 2025 \- Talks are online](https://www.epicweb.dev/talks)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [PodRocket 563 \- JSX over the wire with Dan Abramov](https://podrocket.logrocket.com/jsx-over-the-wire-dan-abramov)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [Syntax.fm 901 \- New React & Svelte APIs, RSC Updates, Redwood and Storybook](https://syntax.fm/show/901/js-news-new-react-and-svelte-apis-rsc-updates-redwood-and-storybook)

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ¥ [Matt Pocock \- Arrays, objects... now `composites`?](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hFenspfGLTk): The exciting JS proposal that replaces Records and Tuples.
- ğŸ“œ [Introducing Rslib: Build library with Rspack](https://lib.rsbuild.dev/blog/introducing-rslib): Developed by ByteDance Web Infra Team, Rslib is a library that aims to be an ideal library development tool that is easy to configure, offers comprehensive features, leverages a shared ecosystem with application building, and prioritizes performance.
- ğŸ“œ [shape(): A New Powerful Drawing Syntax in CSS](https://frontendmasters.com/blog/shape-a-new-powerful-drawing-syntax-in-css/): A new function of clip-path is now supported, which lets you to clip your element using arbitrary and responsive shapes.
- ğŸ“œ [The CSS Height Enigma](https://www.joshwcomeau.com/css/height-enigma/)
- ğŸ“œ [How V8 JavaScript Engine Works Behind the Scenes](https://www.deepintodev.com/blog/how-v8-javascript-engine-works-behind-the-scenes)
- ğŸ“œ [The Art of Accessibility](https://playfulprogramming.com/collections/art-of-accessibility)
- ğŸ“œ [Making a new form control \- with Custom Elements](https://plainvanillaweb.com/blog/articles/2025-05-09-form-control/)
- ğŸ“¦ [Lightning CSS 1.30 \- Relative color spec, nesting spec for pseudo elements, build support on Android, and more](https://github.com/parcel-bundler/lightningcss/releases/tag/v1.30.0)
